intro: Conophyllum chrysoleucum, commonly known as the golden white conophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access water from deeper soil layers. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
